description.value: A reference to the Data Element that corresponds to the question text and answer constraints for this question.

definition.value: A reference to the Data Element that corresponds to the question text and answer constraints for this question.

comments.value: If a code applies to a question, that code should still be conveyed on the question, even if the same code is also referenced as a DataElement.code in the referenced data element. This extension must not be used in place of specifying the Questionnaire.item.concept element.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comments.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

definition.value: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
A reference to the Data Element that corresponds to the question text and answer constraints for this question.

comments.value: If a code applies to a question, that code should still be conveyed on the question, even if the same code is also referenced as a DataElement.code in the referenced data element. This extension must not be used in place of specifying the Questionnaire.item.concept element.
